User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1b1) Gecko/20060806 BonEcho/2.0b1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1b1) Gecko/20060806 BonEcho/2.0b1

In the new winstripe theme, go and search buttons are not native, but simple graphics.

This causes some problems:
1. They do not scale with the urlbar/searchbar when large fonts are used
2. They look misplaced under the classic theme or some third party themes
3. They do not respect ative look and feel

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use large Fonts (For example 200 dpi)
or
1. Install a third party theme
or
1. Use the classic windows theme and use a dark or colorful color scheme
Actual Results:  
Go and search buttons do not scale with the urlbar and searchbar, do not look native, and look misplaced.

Expected Results:  
Buttons should "respect OS native look and feel" like desribed in http://wiki.mozilla.org/FX2_Visual_Update/Default_Theme_Update .

comments.author: jgoldman@radiantcore.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 233494
Winstripe image replacements: transparent end cap buttons

These images replace the ones in the new theme, giving the 'endcaps' a transparent background so that they work better when the colour behind them changes. These images should replace the images in:

/mozilla/browser/themes/winstripe/global/icons/

This doesn't address any of the spacing or sizing problems, which are other bugs, but should fix situations in which the theme has changed the OS colours. It should also allow users to make changes in their userChrome.css and apply different background colours to these buttons or to the elements behind them.
